LoginAdsContent: QuickImmi optimizes your immigration process with AI-driven solutions. Our platform efficiently and accurately handles complex documents, provides personalized immigration guidance, and ensures clear task management with real-time case tracking. Experience a seamless immigration transformation powered by AI.

LandingPage.BrandText: Fast-Track Your American Dream with AI
LandingPage.AutoDocGenerationDescription: Transform applicant’s raw data into polished immigration documents at the click of a button. Our AI crafts tailored, professional-grade petitions and supporting materials in seconds.
LandingPage.AiInfoCollectionDescription: Say goodbye to tedious paperwork. Our smart forms adapt in real-time, auto-suggesting information and catching errors, ensuring accuracy and speed.
LandingPage.SmartCaseManagementDescription: Stay in control post-submission with our comprehensive dashboard. Get real-time updates, predictive insights, and proactive alerts to keep your cases moving forward efficiently.
LandingPage.SmartCaseManagementListItem1: Real-time case tracking and case flow management
LandingPage.AiAssistDescription: Jumpstart your case with AI-driven intake. Our system intelligently categorizes and sets up the perfect workflow, saving you hours of manual setup time.
LandingPage.AiAssistDescriptionListItem1: Instant AI consultations with our customized immigration law LLM
LandingPage.FeaturesTitle: Elevate Your Practice with AI-Driven Features
LandingPage.FeatureInstantDocGenerationDescription: Reduce 15+ hours of manual paperwork to mere a few seconds.
LandingPage.FeatureCasePreparationDescription: Compress 3-4 weeks of case buildup into 2-3 hours of focused work, leveraging AI-assisted information gathering.
LandingPage.FeatureNoErrorDocumentationDescription: Achieve 99.9% accuracy with AI-powered form filling and dual-layer error checking, minimizing RFEs.
LandingPage.FeatureLawyerClientInteractionDescriptio: Reduce client queries by 75% through our Smart interaction system, saving 20+ hours per case in back-and-forth exchanges.
LandingPage.FeatureProfitBoostDescription: Reduce case preparation time by 80%, allowing for a 3x increase in caseload without additional staff.
LandingPage.FeatureDataSecurityDescription: 100% cloud-based enhanced data protection and client confidentiality.
LandingPage.GrowYourBusiness: Grow Your Business with the Power of Quickimmi
LandingPage.IncreaseCaseloadCapacity: Increase in caseload capacity without additional staff
LandingPage.SubmitForReviewLawyerReviewDescription: Lawyer-verified documentation to guarantee flawless compliance and peace of mind.
LandingPage.SubmitForReviewNotificationDescription: Stay informed with live updates, ensuring transparency and guidance at every step.
LandingPage.SignupEntryTitle: Sign Up for a Fast Immigration Process Powered by AI
LandingPage.AiFilterTypeDescription: Provides real-time answers to immigration queries, bypassing email delays.
LandingPage.AiCompleteDescription: Automatically generates accurate documents, reducing errors and saving time.
LandingPage.AiTranslateDescription: Simply upload documents; AI intelligently extracts relevant information to seamlessly fill in forms.
LandingPage.ProfessionalLawyerDescription: Professional legal reviews to ensure your documentation is flawless and compliant.
LandingPage.TransparentPriceDescription: Transparent and fair pricing ensure you know the costs, with no hidden fees.
LandingPage.TrackProgressDescription: Keep tracking of case status in real-time, providing clarity throughout your journey.
LandingPage.FastTrackDescription1: Revolutionize your U.S. immigration process with cutting-edge AI, fast-tracking your American dream.
LandingPage.FastTrackDescription2: Professional lawyers then perfect the information to ensure a foolproof application

SpouseIsInUS: Is this person in the U.S.?
PlaceOfLastEntryIntoUS: Place of last entry into the U.S.
DateOfLastEntryIntoUS: Date of last entry into the U.S.
WhatsSpouseCurrentStatus: What is your spouse's current status?
WhatsExpirationDate: What is the expiration date of his/her authorized stay, if any?
IsSpouseImmigrationCourt: Is your spouse in Immigration Court proceedings?
DateOfPreviousArrival: If previously in the U.S., date of previous arrival
IsSpouseIncludedInApplication: Is your spouse to be included in this application?
ChildUploadPassport: Upload child's passport or other identity document
ChildrenIsInUS: Is this child in the U.S.?
WhatsChildCurrentStatus: What is your child's current status?
IsChildImmigrationCourt: Is your child in Immigration Court proceedings?
IsChildIncludedInApplication: If in the U.S., is this child to be included in this application?
TelephoneNumberOfMailingInUs: Telephone Number of Mailing Address in U.S.
MostRecentSchool: Please provide information about all the education you have, starting with the most recent one.
MostRecentEmployment: Please provide your employment during the past 5 years. List your present employment first.
mostRecentOutSideUsEmploymentHistory5Yea: Please provide the most recent outside your employment during the past 5 years
AddressPast5Years: List your addresses for the past 5 years. List your present address first.
AddressBeforeUS: List your last address where you lived before coming to the United States. If this is not the country where you fear persecution, also list the last address in the country where you fear persecution.
ImmigrationCourtNever: I have never been in Immigration Court proceedings.
ImmigrationCourtNow: I am now in Immigration Court proceedings.
ImmigrationCourtPast: I am not now in Immigration Court proceedings, but I have been in the past
MailingAddressSameAsResidentialAddress: Mailing Address is the same as Residential Address
MailingAddressSameAsResidentialAddress(N: Mailing Address is the same as Residential Address(Need update to include family based)
WhenLastLeaveCountry: When did you last leave your country?
DateStatusExpires: When does the status of your last entry expire?
EntryRecordsDescription: List each entry into the U.S. beginning with your most recent entry.
MembershipInAParticularSocialGroup: Membership in a Particular Social Group
AsylumBasedOn: 1. I am seeking asylum or withholding of removal based on:
HasExperiencedHarm: A. Have you, your family, or close friends or colleagues ever experienced harm or mistreatment or threats in the past by anyone?
FearReturnHome: B. Do you fear harm or mistreatment if you return to your home country?
ExplainFearReturnHome: If "Yes," explain in detail: 1. What harm or mistreatment you fear; 2. Who you believe would harm or mistreat you; and 3. Why you believe you would or could be harmed or mistreated
FamilyMemberCharged: 2. Have you or your family members ever been accused, charged, arrested, detained, interrogated, convicted and sentenced, or imprisoned in any country other than the United States (including for an immigration law violation)?
ExplainFamilyMemberCharged: If "Yes," explain the circumstances and reasons for the action.
YouOrFamilyBelongToGroup: 3.A. Have you or your family members ever belonged to or been associated with any organizations or groups in your home country, such as, but not limited to, a political party, student group, labor union, religious organization, military or paramilitary group, civil patrol, guerrilla organization, ethnic group, human rights group, or the press or media?
ExplainYouOrFamilyBelongToGroup: If "Yes," describe for each person the level of participation, any leadership or other positions held, and the length of time you or your family members were involved in each organization or activity.
YouOrFamilyContinueBelongToGroup: 3.B. Do you or your family members continue to participate in any way in these organizations or groups?
ExplainYouOrFamilyContinueBelongToGroup: If "Yes," describe for each person your or your family members' current level of participation, any leadership or other positions currently held, and the length of time you or your family members have been involved in each organization or group.
AfraidOfBeingTorturedWhenReturned: 4. Are you afraid of being subjected to torture in your home country or any other country to which you may be returned?
ExplainAfraidOfBeingTorturedWhenReturned: If "Yes," explain why you are afraid and describe the nature of torture you fear, by whom, and why it would be inflicted.
AppliedRefugeeOrAsylumBefore: 1. Have you, your spouse, your child(ren), your parents or your siblings ever applied to the U.S. Government for refugee status, asylum, or withholding of removal?
ExplainAppliedRefugeeOrAsylumBefore: If "Yes," explain the decision and what happened to any status you, your spouse, your child(ren), your parents, or your siblings received as a result of that decision. Indicate whether or not you were included in a parent or spouse's application. If so, include your parent or spouse's A-number in your response. If you have been denied asylum by an immigration judge or the Board of Immigration Appeals, describe any change(s) in conditions in your country or your own personal circumstances since the date of the denial that may affect your eligibility for asylum.
TravelOtherCountryBeforeUS: 2.A. After leaving the country from which you are claiming asylum, did you or your spouse or child(ren) who are now in the United States travel through or reside in any other country before entering the United States?
AnyLawfulStatusAnyCountry: 2.B. Have you, your spouse, your child(ren), or other family members, such as your parents or siblings, ever applied for or received any lawful status in any country other than the one from which you are now claiming asylum?
ExplainAnyLawfulStatusAnyCountry: If "Yes" to either or both questions (2.A. and/or 2.B.), provide for each person the following: the name of each country and the length of stay, the person's status while there, the reasons for leaving, whether or not the person is entitled to return for lawful residence purposes, and whether the person applied for refugee status or for asylum while there, and if not, why he or she did not do so.
HaveHarmedOthers: 3. Have you, your spouse or your child(ren) ever ordered, incited, assisted or otherwise participated in causing harm or suffering to any person because of his or her race, religion, nationality, membership in a particular social group or belief in a particular political opinion?
ExplainHaveHarmedOthers: If "Yes," describe in detail each such incident and your own, your spouse's, or your child(ren)'s involvement.
ReturnCountryAfterBeingHarmed: 4. After you left the country where you were harmed or fear harm, did you return to that country?
ExplainReturnCountryAfterBeingHarmed: If "Yes," describe in detail the circumstances of your visit(s) (for example, the date(s) of the trip(s), the purpose(s) of the trip(s), and the length of time you remained in that country for the visit(s).)
AppliedOneYearAfterYourLastArrival: 5. Are you filing this application more than 1 year after your last arrival in the United States?
ExplainAppliedOneYearAfterYourLastArriva: If "Yes," explain why you did not file within the first year after you arrived. You must be prepared to explain at your interview or hearing why you did not file your asylum application within the first year after you arrived. For guidance in answering this question, see Instructions, Part 1: Filing Instructions, Section V. "Completing the Form," Part C.
HaveCommittedCrime: 6. Have you or any member of your family included in the application ever committed any crime and/or been arrested, charged, convicted, or sentenced for any crimes in the United States (including for an immigration law violation)?
ExplainHaveCommittedCrime: If "Yes," for each instance, specify in your response: what occurred and the circumstances, dates, length of sentence received, location, the duration of the detention or imprisonment, reason(s) for the detention or conviction, any formal charges that were lodged against you or your relatives included in your application, and the reason(s) for release. Attach documents referring to these incidents, if they are available, or an explanation of why documents are not available.
NameInNativeAlphabet: Write your name in your native alphabet
FamilyMemberAssist: Did your spouse, parent, or child(ren) assist you in completing this application?
ListNameAndRelationship: List the name and relationship of the member(s) of your family who assisted you
Name: Name
OtherPeopleAssist: Did someone other than your spouse, parent, or child(ren) prepare this application?
ProvideCounsel: Asylum applicants may be represented by counsel. Have you been provided with a list of persons who may be available to assist you, at little or no cost, with your asylum claim?
G28FormAttached: Select this box if Form G-28 is attached.
AttorneyUscisOnlineAccountNumber: Attorney or Accredited Representative USCIS Online Account Number (if any)
RelationshipWithPetitioner: Relationship (You are the Petitioner. Your relative is the Beneficiary)
FillingPetitionFor: I am filing this petition for my (Select only one box):
DescribeYourRelationship: If you are filing this petition for your child or parent, select the box that describes your relationship (Select only one box):
ChildBornInWedlock: Child was born to parents who were married to each other at the time of the child's birth
ChildNotBornInWedlock: Child was born to parents who were not married to each other at the time of the child's birth
ChildAdopted: Child was adopted (not an Orphan or Hague Convention adoptee)
SiblingRelationship: If the beneficiary is your brother/sister, are you related by adoption?
GainedLegalStatusThroughAdoption: Did you gain lawful permanent resident status or citizenship through adoption?
Provide all other names used: Provide all other names you have ever used, including aliases,maiden name, and nicknames.
MailingAddressSameAsPhysicalAddress: Is your current mailing address the same as your physical address?
AnswerNoForItem11: If you answered "No" to Item Number 11., provide information on your physical address in Item Numbers 12.a. - 13.b.
PgysicalAddressHistory: Provide your physical addresses for the last five years, whether inside or outside the United States. Provide your current address first if it is different from your mailing address in Item Numbers 10.a. - 10.i.
mostRecentOutSideUsAddressBefore5YearsAg: Provide the most recent beneficiary's address outside the Us 5 years ago
HowManyTimesHaveYouBeenMarried: How many times have you been married?
DateOfCurrentMarriage: Date of Current Marriage (if currently married)(mm/dd/yyyy)
PlaceofYourCurrentMarriage(if married): Place of Your Current Marriage (if married)
Names of All Your Spouses: Names of All Your Spouses (if any)
SpousesInformation: Provide information on your current spouse (if currently married) first and then list all your prior spouses (if any).
IAmA: I am a (Select only one box):
If you are a U.S. citizen, complete Item Number 37.
CitizenshipThrough: My citizenship was acquired through (Select only one box):
ObtainedCertificate: Have you obtained a Certificate of Naturalization or a Certificate of Citizenship?
YesForItem38: If you answered "Yes" to Item Number 38., complete the following:
LawfulPermanentResidentToComplete: If you are a lawful permanent resident, complete Item Numbers 40.a. - 41.
GainedStatusThroughMarriage: Did you gain lawful permanent resident status through marriage to a U.S. citizen or lawful permanent resident?
ProvideEmploymentHistory: Provide your employment history for the last five years, whether inside or outside the United States. Provide your current employment first. If you are currently unemployed, type or print "Unemployed" in Item Number 42.
StreetNumberAndNameOfEmployer: Street Number And Name Of Employer
BiographicInformationNote: NOTE: Provide the biographic information about you, the petitioner.
NativeHawaiian: Native Hawaiian or Other Pacific Islander
Provide all other names Beneficiary used: Provide all other names the beneficiary has ever used, including aliases, maiden name, and nicknames.
AnyoneFiledAPetitionForBeneficiary: Has anyone else ever filed a petition for the beneficiary?
NoteOfAnyoneFiledAPetitionForBeneficiary: NOTE: Select "Unknown" only if you do not know, and the beneficiary also does not know, if anyone else has ever filed a petition for the beneficiary.
Beneficiary's Physical Address Note: If the beneficiary lives outside the United States in a home without a street number or name, leave Item Numbers 11.a. and 11.b. blank.
Other Address and Contact Information No: Provide the address in the United States where the beneficiary intends to live, if different from Item Numbers 11.a. - 11.h. If the address is the same, type or print "SAME" in Item Number 12.a.
Provide the beneficiary's address outside the United States, if different from Item Numbers 11.a. - 11.h. If the address is the same, type or print "SAME" in Item Number 13.a.
HowManyTimesHasTheBeneficiaryBeenMarried: How many times has the beneficiary been married?
PlaceofBeneficiary'sCurrentMarriage(if m: Place of Beneficiary's Current Marriage(if married)
Beneficiary'sSpousesInformation: Provide information on the beneficiary's current spouse (if currently married) first and then list all the beneficiary's prior spouses (if any).
NotesOfBeneficiary'sFamilyInformation: Provide information about the beneficiary's spouse and children.
WasBeneficiaryEVERInUS: Was the beneficiary EVER in the United States?
IfTheBeneficiaryIsInUS: If the beneficiary is currently in the United States, complete Items Numbers 46.a. - 46.d.
BeneficiaryArrivedAs: He or she arrived as a (Class of Admission):
StatusOfDateAuthorizedStay: Date authorized stay expired, or will expire, as shown on Form I-94 or Form I-95 (mm/dd/yyyy) or type or print "D/S" for Duration of Status
CountryOfIssuanceForPassportOrTravelDocu: Country of Issuance for Passport or Travel Document
ExpirationDateForPassportOrTravelDocumen: Expiration Date for Passport or Travel Document(mm/dd/yyyy)
ProvideBeneficiary'sCurrentEmploymentInf: Provide the beneficiary's current employment information (if applicable), even if they are employed outside of the United States. If the beneficiary is currently unemployed, type or print "Unemployed" in Item Number 51.a.
WasBeneficiaryEVERInImmigrationProceedin: Was the beneficiary EVER in immigration proceedings?
IfAnsweredYesSelectType: If you answered "Yes," select the type of proceedings and provide the location and date of the proceedings.
Beneficiary'sNativeWrittenLanguageDoesNo: If the beneficiary's native written language does not use Roman letters, type or print his or her name and foreign address in their native written language.
FilingForSpouse: If filing for your spouse, provide the last address at which you physically lived together. If you never lived together, type or print, "Never lived together" in Item Number 59.a.
BeneficiaryWillApplyForAdjustment: The beneficiary is in the United States and will apply for adjustment of status to that of a lawful permanent resident at the U.S. Citizenship and Immigration Services (USCIS) office in:
BeneficiaryWillNotApplyForAdjustment: The beneficiary will not apply for adjustment of status in the United States, but he or she will apply for an immigrant visa abroad at the U.S. Embassy or U.S. Consulate in:
NoteOfBeneficiaryApplication: NOTE: Choosing a U.S. Embassy or U.S. Consulate outside the country of the beneficiary's last residence does not guarantee that it will accept the beneficiary's case for processing. In these situations, the designated U.S. Embassy or U.S. Consulate has discretion over whether or not to accept the beneficiary's case.
FiledPetitionBefore: Have you EVER previously filed a petition for this beneficiary or any other alien?
AnsweredYes: If you answered "Yes," provide the name, place, date of filing, and the result.
SubmitPetitionsForOtherRelatives: If you are also submitting separate petitions for other relatives, provide the names of and your relationship to each relative.
WARNING: WARNING: USCIS investigates the claimed relationships and verifies the validity of documents you submit. If you falsify a family relationship to obtain a visa, USCIS may seek to have you criminally prosecuted.
PENALTIES: PENALTIES: By law, you may be imprisoned for up to 5 years or fined $250,000, or both, for entering into a marriage contract in order to evade any U.S. immigration law. In addition, you may be fined up to $10,000 and imprisoned for up to 5 years, or both, for knowingly and willfully falsifying or concealing a material fact or using any false document in submitting this petition.
Petitioner'sStatementContactInformatione: Petitioner's Statement, Contact Information, Declaration, and Signature
NoteOfPetitioner: NOTE: Read the Penalties section of the Form I-130 Instructions before completing this part.
NoteOfPetitioner'sStatement: NOTE: Select the box for either Item Number 1.a. or 1.b. If applicable, select the box for Item Number 2.
Petitioner'sStatementOption1a: I can read and understand English, and I have read and understand every question and instruction on this petition and my answer to every question.
Petitioner'sStatementOption1b: The interpreter named in Part 7. read to me every question and instruction on this petition and my answer to every question in 1.b. a language in which I am fluent. I understood all of this information as interpreted.
PreparerName: At my request, the preparer named in Part 8., prepared this petition for me based only upon information I provided or authorized.
Petitioner'sDeclarationAndCertificationC: Copies of any documents I have submitted are exact photocopies of unaltered, original documents, and I understand that USCIS may require that I submit original documents to USCIS at a later date. Furthermore, I authorize the release of any information from any of my records that USCIS may need to determine my eligibility for the immigration benefit I seek. I further authorize release of information contained in this petition, in supporting documents, and in my USCIS records to other entities and persons where necessary for the administration and enforcement of U.S. immigration laws. I understand that USCIS may require me to appear for an appointment to take my biometrics (fingerprints, photograph, and/or signature) and, at that time, if I am required to provide biometrics, I will be required to sign an oath reaffirming that: 1) I provided or authorized all of the information contained in, and submitted with, my petition; 2) I reviewed and understood all of the information in, and submitted with, my petition; and 3) All of this information was complete, true, and correct at the time of filing. I certify, under penalty of perjury, that all of the information in my petition and any document submitted with it were provided or authorized by me, that I reviewed and understand all of the information contained in, and submitted with, my petition, and that all of this information is complete, true, and correct.
NOTETOALLPETITIONERS: NOTE TO ALL PETITIONERS: If you do not completely fill out this petition or fail to submit required documents listed in the Instructions, USCIS may deny your petition.
Interpreter'sContactInformationCertifica: Interpreter's Contact Information, Certification, and Signature
ProvideInterpreterInformation: Provide the following information about the interpreter if you used one.
Interpreter'sBusinessOrOrganizationName: Interpreter's Business or Organization Name (if any)
Interpreter'sCertificationContent: I certify, under penalty of perjury, that: I am fluent in English and which is the same language provided in Part 6., Item Number 1.b., and I have read to this petitioner in the identified language every question and instruction on this petition and his or her answer to every question. The petitioner informed me that he or she understands every instruction, question, and answer on the petition, including the Petitioner's Declaration and Certification, and has verified the accuracy of every answer.
InformationOfPersonPreparingThisPetition: Contact Information, Declaration, and Signature of the Person Preparing this Petition, if Other Than the Petitioner
Provide the following information about the preparer.
Preparer'sBusinessOrOrganizationName: Preparer's Business or Organization Name (if any)
Preparer'sStatementOption7a: I am not an attorney or accredited representative but have prepared this petition on behalf of the petitioner and with the petitioner's consent.
Preparer'sStatementOption7B: I am an attorney or accredited representative and my representation of the petitioner in this case extends does not extend beyond the preparation of this petition
NoteOfPreparer'sStatement: NOTE: If you are an attorney or accredited representative whose representation extends beyond preparation of this petition, you may be obliged to submit a completed Form G-28, Notice of Entry of Appearance as Attorney or Accredited Representative, with this petition.
Preparer'sCertificationContent: By my signature, I certify, under penalty of perjury, that I prepared this petition at the request of the petitioner. The petitioner then reviewed this completed petition and informed me that he or she understands all of the information contained in, and submitted with, his or her petition, including the Petitioner's Declaration and Certification, and that all of this information is complete, true, and correct. I completed this petition based only on information that the petitioner provided to me or authorized me to obtain or use.
AdditionalInformationContent: If you need extra space to provide any additional information within this petition, use the space below. If you need more space than what is provided, you may make copies of this page to complete and file with this petition or attach a separate sheet of paper. Type or print your name and A-Number (if any) at the top of each sheet; indicate the Page Number, Part Number, and Item Number to which your answer refers; and sign and date each sheet.
RaceOptions: Native Hawaiian or Other Pacific Islander
